data.title: Shangguan (surname)
data.meta_description: Shangguan is a Chinese compound surname.
data.text:
Shangguan (Chinese: 上官) is a Chinese compound surname.

During the Warring States period, Zilan[zh], a son of King Huai of Chu, settled in Shangguan[zh]. Zilan's descendants took the place name as their surname. Following Qin's wars of unification, the Shangguan family and others loyal to the state of Chu were forced to relocate.[1] The surname is prominent in Gansu, around Tianshui. A second wave of migration after the Tang dynasty ended saw many members of the Shangguan family settle in Fujian.

Shangguan is listed 411th in the Hundred Family Surnames.
